summary: The t-test is a way to check if there's a real difference between two groups' responses. It uses something called a t-distribution when the data isn't normally distributed. This test is useful when we don't know a certain value that affects the data. It's often used to compare the averages of two groups. As the number of data points increases, the t-test results become similar to those of a Z-test.
title: Student's t-test
